newsitem.title: USA: NYS unemployment rate stays at 5.7 percent in Nov.
newsitem.headline: NYS unemployment rate stays at 5.7 percent in Nov.

text.p: New York State's unemployment rate, which dropped under six percent in September for the first time in almost six years, remained at 5.7 percent in November, the state labor department said on Monday.

Further, the state department added the total number of people who were unemployed was under 500,000 for the third month in a row, while nonfarm jobs rose 28,300 in November, an average rise for the season.
Still, the state's unemployment rate exceeded the national rate in November, which stood at five percent, and New York City saw its rate rise two percentage points to 8.5 percent.

Columbia County with a 2.8 percent rate, and Putnam and Tompkins, which both had 2.9 percent rates, had the lowest levels of unemployment in the state, while the highest rates were seen in Hamilton, at 13 percent, the Bronx, at 11 percent and Kings County, at 9.5 percent.

Employment rose by 26,100 in wholesale and retail trade, 12,000 in government, and 3,600 in services. But the construction sector shed 8,800 jobs, with manufacturing losing 2,300, transportation and public utilities 1,700, finance, insurance and real estate 300, and mining 100.
A breakdown of some of the state labor report's highlights for metropolitan areas follows.
--Albany-Schenectady-Troy, unemployment fell to 3.7 percent in November from 3.9 percent a monthago and 4.7 percent a year ago.
--Binghamton, unemployment steadied at 3.6 percent from a month-ago, down from 4.8 percent a year ago.
--Buffalo-Niagara Falls, unemployment flat at 4.6 percent with a month ago, and down from 4.9 percent a year ago.
--Duchess County, unemployment fell to 3.7 percent from four percent a month ago and 4.1 percent a year ago.
--Elmira, unemployment fell to 3.6 percent from 3.8 percent a month ago and 4.3 percent a year ago.
--Glens Falls, unemployment rose to six percent from five percent a month ago, though rate was down from 6.5 percent a year ago.
--Nassau-Suffolk, unemployment fell to 3.3 percent in November, from 3.7 percent a month ago and 4.4 percent a year ago.
--Newburgh, NY-Penn., unemployment fell to 3.5 percent from 3.9 percent a month ago and 4.3 percent a year ago.
--New York City, unemployment rose to 8.5 percent from 8.3 percent a month ago and eight percent a year-ago.
--For eight counties in the New York area, unemployment was 7.7 percent in November, up from 7.6 percent a month ago and 7.4 percent a year-ago.
--Rochester, unemployment fell to 3.4 percent from 3.5 percent a month ago and four percent a year ago.
--Syracuse, unemployment flat at 4.2 percent, and down from 5.3 percent a year ago.
--Utica-Rome, unemployment rose to 4.6 percent from 4.3 percent a month ago and 5.2 percent a year ago.
--Joan Gralla, 212-859-1654
